title: DatumBox
description: Datumbox offers a Machine Learning platform composed of 14 classifiers and Natural Language processing functions. Functions include sentiment analysis, topic classification, readability assessment, language detection, and much more.

actions.title: AdultContentDetection
actions.description: The Adult Content Detection function classifies the documents as adult or noadult based on their context. It can be used to detect whether a document contains content unsuitable for minors.

text.description: The text that you want to analyze. It should not contain HTML tags.

actions.title: CommercialDetection
actions.description: The Commercial Detection function labels the documents as commercial or non-commercial based on their keywords and expressions. It can be used to detect whether a website is commercial or not.

text.description: The text that you want to analyze. It should not contain HTML tags.

actions.title: DocumentSimilarity
actions.description: The Document Similarity function estimates the degree of similarity between two documents. It can be used to detect duplicate webpages or detect plagiarism.

original.description: The first text. It should not contain HTML tags.

copy.description: The second text. It should not contain HTML tags.

actions.title: EducationalDetection
actions.description: The Educational Detection function classifies the documents as educational or non-educational based on their context. It can be used to detect whether a website is educational or not.

text.description: The text that you want to analyze. It should not contain HTML tags.

actions.title: GenderDetection
actions.description: The Gender Detection function identifies if a particular document is written-by or targets-to a man or a woman based on the context, the words and the idioms found in the text.

text.description: The text that you want to analyze. It should not contain HTML tags.

actions.title: KeywordExtraction
actions.description: The Keyword Extraction function enables you to extract from an arbitrary document all the keywords and word-combinations along with their occurrences in the text.

n.description: The number of keyword combinations (n-grams) that you wish to extract.

text.description: The text that you want to analyze. It should not contain HTML tags.

actions.title: LanguageDetection
actions.description: The Language Detection function identifies the natural language of the given document based on its words and context. This classifier is able to detect 96 different languages.

text.description: The text that you want to analyze. It should not contain HTML tags.

actions.title: ReadabilityAssessment
actions.description: The Readability Assessment function determines the degree of readability of a document based on its terms and idioms. The texts are classified as basic, intermediate and advanced depending their difficulty.

text.description: The text that you want to analyze. It should not contain HTML tags.

actions.title: SentimentAnalysis
actions.description: The Sentiment Analysis function classifies documents as positive, negative or neutral (lack of sentiment) depending on whether they express a positive, negative or neutral opinion.

text.description: The text that you want to analyze. It should not contain HTML tags.

actions.title: SpamDetection
actions.description: The Spam Detection function labels documents as spam or nospam by taking into account their context. It can be used to filter out spam emails and comments.

text.description: The text that you want to analyze. It should not contain HTML tags.

actions.title: SubjectivityAnalysis
actions.description: The Subjectivity Analysis function categorizes documents as subjective or objective based on their writing style. Texts that express personal opinions are labeled as subjective and the others as objective.

text.description: The text that you want to analyze. It should not contain HTML tags.

actions.title: TextExtraction
actions.description: The Text Extraction function enables you to extract the important information from a given webpage. Extracting the clear text of the documents is an important step before any other analysis.

text.description: The HTML source of the webpage.

actions.title: TopicClassification
actions.description: The Topic Classification function assigns documents in 12 thematic categories based on their keywords, idioms and jargon. It can be used to identify the topic of the texts.

text.description: The text that you want to analyze. It should not contain HTML tags.

actions.title: TwitterSentimentAnalysis
actions.description: The Twitter Sentiment Analysis function allows you to perform Sentiment Analysis on Twitter. It classifies the tweets as positive, negative or neutral depending on their context.

text.description: The text of the tweet that we evaluate.
